body_content.explanation: a disease in which there is a loss or reduction of movement in a part of the body as a result of a problem with the brain or nerves:
examples: Facial nerve palsy is usually transient and shows a good response to steroids.
Many patients who have had such surgery have suffered strokes and nerve palsies.

body_content.explanation: a condition in which the whole body or the legs, hands, arms, etc. shake because of a problem with the muscles:
examples: Parkinson's Disease is the shaking palsy that afflicts many elderly people.
Complicated migraines are headaches accompanied by sensory or motor deficits or muscle palsies.
